titles.title: Put On Thy Beautiful Garments, O Jerusalem

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Chorus:
Put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem.
Put on thy beautiful garments, lovely bride.
Thou art a city filled with light,
O, how glorious is thy sight.
Put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
When I passed by thee and looked upon thee,
Behold, thy time was the time of love.
I made a covenant and sware unto thee
And thou becamest mine, beloved done.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Yea, then I washed thee, with oil anointed thee,
And clothed thee with embroidered work and linen fine.
With jewels and earrings rare have I adorned thee.
Thou art all fair, my love, and thou art mine.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Thy garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia,
Like a sweet garden, a bed of spice.
The King doth greatly desire thy beauty,
Thou art to me the pearl of greatest price.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
O turn thine eyes away, they overcome me.
My heart is ravished, loved with such a sight.
Thou art my precious one, thou art my glory.
And thou art clothed in linen, clean and white.
